004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.MetersPerSecond;
008import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Volts;
009import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
010
011import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.HolonomicDriveController;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.ProfiledPIDController;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.SimpleMotorFeedforward;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.MecanumDriveKinematics;
019import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.MecanumDriveMotorVoltages;
020import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds;
021import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.Trajectory;
022import edu.wpi.first.units.Distance;
023import edu.wpi.first.units.MutableMeasure;
024import edu.wpi.first.units.Velocity;
025import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
026import java.util.function.Consumer;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029/**
030 * A command that uses two PID controllers ({@link PIDController}) and a ProfiledPIDController
031 * ({@link ProfiledPIDController}) to follow a trajectory {@link Trajectory} with a mecanum drive.
032 *
033 * <p>The command handles trajectory-following, Velocity PID calculations, and feedforwards
034 * internally. This is intended to be a more-or-less "complete solution" that can be used by teams
035 * without a great deal of controls expertise.
036 *
037 * <p>Advanced teams seeking more flexibility (for example, those who wish to use the onboard PID
038 * functionality of a "smart" motor controller) may use the secondary constructor that omits the PID
039 * and feedforward functionality, returning only the raw wheel speeds from the PID controllers.
040 *
041 * <p>The robot angle controller does not follow the angle given by the trajectory but rather goes
042 * to the angle given in the final state of the trajectory.
043 *
044 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
045 */
046public class MecanumControllerCommand extends Command {
047  private final Timer m_timer = new Timer();
048  private final boolean m_usePID;
049  private final Trajectory m_trajectory;
050  private final Supplier<Pose2d> m_pose;
051  private final SimpleMotorFeedforward m_feedforward;
052  private final MecanumDriveKinematics m_kinematics;
053  private final HolonomicDriveController m_controller;
054  private final Supplier<Rotation2d> m_desiredRotation;
055  private final double m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond;
056  private final PIDController m_frontLeftController;
057  private final PIDController m_rearLeftController;
058  private final PIDController m_frontRightController;
059  private final PIDController m_rearRightController;
060  private final Supplier<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> m_currentWheelSpeeds;
061  private final Consumer<MecanumDriveMotorVoltages> m_outputDriveVoltages;
062  private final Consumer<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> m_outputWheelSpeeds;
063  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_prevFrontLeftSpeedSetpoint =
064      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
065  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_prevRearLeftSpeedSetpoint =
066      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
067  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_prevFrontRightSpeedSetpoint =
068      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
069  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_prevRearRightSpeedSetpoint =
070      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
071  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint =
072      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
073  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint =
074      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
075  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint =
076      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
077  private final MutableMeasure<Velocity<Distance>> m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint =
078      MutableMeasure.zero(MetersPerSecond);
079
080  /**
081   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
082   * trajectory. PID control and feedforward are handled internally. Outputs are scaled from -12 to
083   * 12 as a voltage output to the motor.
084   *
085   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path
086   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary endstates.
087   *
088   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
089   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
090   *     provide this.
091   * @param feedforward The feedforward to use for the drivetrain.
092   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
093   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
094   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
095   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
096   * @param desiredRotation The angle that the robot should be facing. This is sampled at each time
097   *     step.
098   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
099   * @param frontLeftController The front left wheel velocity PID.
100   * @param rearLeftController The rear left wheel velocity PID.
101   * @param frontRightController The front right wheel velocity PID.
102   * @param rearRightController The rear right wheel velocity PID.
103   * @param currentWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the current wheel speeds.
104   * @param outputDriveVoltages A MecanumDriveMotorVoltages object containing the output motor
105   *     voltages.
106   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
107   */
108  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
109  public MecanumControllerCommand(
110      Trajectory trajectory,
111      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
112      SimpleMotorFeedforward feedforward,
113      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
114      PIDController xController,
115      PIDController yController,
116      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
117      Supplier<Rotation2d> desiredRotation,
118      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
119      PIDController frontLeftController,
120      PIDController rearLeftController,
121      PIDController frontRightController,
122      PIDController rearRightController,
123      Supplier<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> currentWheelSpeeds,
124      Consumer<MecanumDriveMotorVoltages> outputDriveVoltages,
125      Subsystem... requirements) {
126    m_trajectory = requireNonNullParam(trajectory, "trajectory", "MecanumControllerCommand");
127    m_pose = requireNonNullParam(pose, "pose", "MecanumControllerCommand");
128    m_feedforward = requireNonNullParam(feedforward, "feedforward", "MecanumControllerCommand");
129    m_kinematics = requireNonNullParam(kinematics, "kinematics", "MecanumControllerCommand");
130
131    m_controller =
132        new HolonomicDriveController(
133            requireNonNullParam(xController, "xController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
134            requireNonNullParam(yController, "yController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
135            requireNonNullParam(thetaController, "thetaController", "MecanumControllerCommand"));
136
137    m_desiredRotation =
138        requireNonNullParam(desiredRotation, "desiredRotation", "MecanumControllerCommand");
139
140    m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond = maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond;
141
142    m_frontLeftController =
143        requireNonNullParam(frontLeftController, "frontLeftController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
144    m_rearLeftController =
145        requireNonNullParam(rearLeftController, "rearLeftController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
146    m_frontRightController =
147        requireNonNullParam(
148            frontRightController, "frontRightController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
149    m_rearRightController =
150        requireNonNullParam(rearRightController, "rearRightController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
151
152    m_currentWheelSpeeds =
153        requireNonNullParam(currentWheelSpeeds, "currentWheelSpeeds", "MecanumControllerCommand");
154
155    m_outputDriveVoltages =
156        requireNonNullParam(outputDriveVoltages, "outputDriveVoltages", "MecanumControllerCommand");
157
158    m_outputWheelSpeeds = null;
159
160    m_usePID = true;
161
162    addRequirements(requirements);
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
167   * trajectory. PID control and feedforward are handled internally. Outputs are scaled from -12 to
168   * 12 as a voltage output to the motor.
169   *
170   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path
171   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary endstates.
172   *
173   * <p>Note 2: The final rotation of the robot will be set to the rotation of the final pose in the
174   * trajectory. The robot will not follow the rotations from the poses at each timestep. If
175   * alternate rotation behavior is desired, the other constructor with a supplier for rotation
176   * should be used.
177   *
178   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
179   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
180   *     provide this.
181   * @param feedforward The feedforward to use for the drivetrain.
182   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
183   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
184   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
185   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
186   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
187   * @param frontLeftController The front left wheel velocity PID.
188   * @param rearLeftController The rear left wheel velocity PID.
189   * @param frontRightController The front right wheel velocity PID.
190   * @param rearRightController The rear right wheel velocity PID.
191   * @param currentWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the current wheel speeds.
192   * @param outputDriveVoltages A MecanumDriveMotorVoltages object containing the output motor
193   *     voltages.
194   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
195   */
196  public MecanumControllerCommand(
197      Trajectory trajectory,
198      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
199      SimpleMotorFeedforward feedforward,
200      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
201      PIDController xController,
202      PIDController yController,
203      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
204      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
205      PIDController frontLeftController,
206      PIDController rearLeftController,
207      PIDController frontRightController,
208      PIDController rearRightController,
209      Supplier<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> currentWheelSpeeds,
210      Consumer<MecanumDriveMotorVoltages> outputDriveVoltages,
211      Subsystem... requirements) {
212    this(
213        trajectory,
214        pose,
215        feedforward,
216        kinematics,
217        xController,
218        yController,
219        thetaController,
220        () ->
221            trajectory.getStates().get(trajectory.getStates().size() - 1).poseMeters.getRotation(),
222        maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
223        frontLeftController,
224        rearLeftController,
225        frontRightController,
226        rearRightController,
227        currentWheelSpeeds,
228        outputDriveVoltages,
229        requirements);
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
234   * trajectory. The user should implement a velocity PID on the desired output wheel velocities.
235   *
236   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path -
237   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary end-states.
238   *
239   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
240   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
241   *     provide this.
242   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
243   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
244   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
245   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
246   * @param desiredRotation The angle that the robot should be facing. This is sampled at each time
247   *     step.
248   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
249   * @param outputWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the output wheel speeds.
250   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
251   */
252  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
253  public MecanumControllerCommand(
254      Trajectory trajectory,
255      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
256      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
257      PIDController xController,
258      PIDController yController,
259      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
260      Supplier<Rotation2d> desiredRotation,
261      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
262      Consumer<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> outputWheelSpeeds,
263      Subsystem... requirements) {
264    m_trajectory = requireNonNullParam(trajectory, "trajectory", "MecanumControllerCommand");
265    m_pose = requireNonNullParam(pose, "pose", "MecanumControllerCommand");
266    m_feedforward = new SimpleMotorFeedforward(0, 0, 0);
267    m_kinematics = requireNonNullParam(kinematics, "kinematics", "MecanumControllerCommand");
268
269    m_controller =
270        new HolonomicDriveController(
271            requireNonNullParam(xController, "xController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
272            requireNonNullParam(yController, "yController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
273            requireNonNullParam(thetaController, "thetaController", "MecanumControllerCommand"));
274
275    m_desiredRotation =
276        requireNonNullParam(desiredRotation, "desiredRotation", "MecanumControllerCommand");
277
278    m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond = maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond;
279
280    m_frontLeftController = null;
281    m_rearLeftController = null;
282    m_frontRightController = null;
283    m_rearRightController = null;
284
285    m_currentWheelSpeeds = null;
286
287    m_outputWheelSpeeds =
288        requireNonNullParam(outputWheelSpeeds, "outputWheelSpeeds", "MecanumControllerCommand");
289
290    m_outputDriveVoltages = null;
291
292    m_usePID = false;
293
294    addRequirements(requirements);
295  }
296
297  /**
298   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
299   * trajectory. The user should implement a velocity PID on the desired output wheel velocities.
300   *
301   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path -
302   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary end-states.
303   *
304   * <p>Note 2: The final rotation of the robot will be set to the rotation of the final pose in the
305   * trajectory. The robot will not follow the rotations from the poses at each timestep. If
306   * alternate rotation behavior is desired, the other constructor with a supplier for rotation
307   * should be used.
308   *
309   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
310   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
311   *     provide this.
312   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
313   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
314   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
315   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
316   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
317   * @param outputWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the output wheel speeds.
318   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
319   */
320  public MecanumControllerCommand(
321      Trajectory trajectory,
322      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
323      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
324      PIDController xController,
325      PIDController yController,
326      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
327      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
328      Consumer<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> outputWheelSpeeds,
329      Subsystem... requirements) {
330    this(
331        trajectory,
332        pose,
333        kinematics,
334        xController,
335        yController,
336        thetaController,
337        () ->
338            trajectory.getStates().get(trajectory.getStates().size() - 1).poseMeters.getRotation(),
339        maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
340        outputWheelSpeeds,
341        requirements);
342  }
343
344  @Override
345  public void initialize() {
346    var initialState = m_trajectory.sample(0);
347
348    var initialXVelocity =
349        initialState.velocityMetersPerSecond * initialState.poseMeters.getRotation().getCos();
350    var initialYVelocity =
351        initialState.velocityMetersPerSecond * initialState.poseMeters.getRotation().getSin();
352
353    MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds prevSpeeds =
354        m_kinematics.toWheelSpeeds(new ChassisSpeeds(initialXVelocity, initialYVelocity, 0.0));
355
356    m_prevFrontLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.frontLeftMetersPerSecond);
357    m_prevRearLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.rearLeftMetersPerSecond);
358    m_prevFrontRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.frontRightMetersPerSecond);
359    m_prevRearRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.rearRightMetersPerSecond);
360
361    m_timer.restart();
362  }
363
364  @Override
365  public void execute() {
366    double curTime = m_timer.get();
367
368    var desiredState = m_trajectory.sample(curTime);
369
370    var targetChassisSpeeds =
371        m_controller.calculate(m_pose.get(), desiredState, m_desiredRotation.get());
372    var targetWheelSpeeds = m_kinematics.toWheelSpeeds(targetChassisSpeeds);
373
374    targetWheelSpeeds.desaturate(m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond);
375
376    m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.frontLeftMetersPerSecond);
377    m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.rearLeftMetersPerSecond);
378    m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.frontRightMetersPerSecond);
379    m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.rearRightMetersPerSecond);
380
381    double frontLeftOutput;
382    double rearLeftOutput;
383    double frontRightOutput;
384    double rearRightOutput;
385
386    if (m_usePID) {
387      final double frontLeftFeedforward =
388          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevFrontLeftSpeedSetpoint, m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
389
390      final double rearLeftFeedforward =
391          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevRearLeftSpeedSetpoint, m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
392
393      final double frontRightFeedforward =
394          m_feedforward
395              .calculate(m_prevFrontRightSpeedSetpoint, m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint)
396              .in(Volts);
397
398      final double rearRightFeedforward =
399          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevRearRightSpeedSetpoint, m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
400
401      frontLeftOutput =
402          frontLeftFeedforward
403              + m_frontLeftController.calculate(
404                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().frontLeftMetersPerSecond,
405                  m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
406
407      rearLeftOutput =
408          rearLeftFeedforward
409              + m_rearLeftController.calculate(
410                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().rearLeftMetersPerSecond,
411                  m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
412
413      frontRightOutput =
414          frontRightFeedforward
415              + m_frontRightController.calculate(
416                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().frontRightMetersPerSecond,
417                  m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
418
419      rearRightOutput =
420          rearRightFeedforward
421              + m_rearRightController.calculate(
422                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().rearRightMetersPerSecond,
423                  m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
424
425      m_outputDriveVoltages.accept(
426          new MecanumDriveMotorVoltages(
427              frontLeftOutput, frontRightOutput, rearLeftOutput, rearRightOutput));
428
429    } else {
430      m_outputWheelSpeeds.accept(
431          new MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds(
432              m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond),
433              m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond),
434              m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond),
435              m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond)));
436    }
437  }
438
439  @Override
440  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
441    m_timer.stop();
442  }
443
444  @Override
445  public boolean isFinished() {
446    return m_timer.hasElapsed(m_trajectory.getTotalTimeSeconds());
447  }
448}
